intro: Phyteuma argutum, commonly known as the rough phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Its flowers, which range in color from white to violet, bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phytoema argutum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
